newsitem.title: USA: Remote access systems market nearly $1 billion in quarter.
newsitem.headline: Remote access systems market nearly $1 billion in quarter.

text.p: Sales of computer equipment used to connect workers at home or on the road with a central office are booming, with worldwide revenue hitting $941 million in the first quarter, Dataquest said Tuesday.

The market for such equipment, called remote access systems, has become one of the fastest-growing parts in the networking industry, and is on track to nearly double 1995's revenue of $2.6 billion, the computer market research firm said.

"Growth in the remote access market will continue to accelerate through the end of the century as new users drive demand for equipment," said Bobbi Murphy, director and principal analyst in San Jose, Calif.-based Dataquest's Remote Access programme.
"The glut of new users also will drive demand for larger, more integrated systems that can handle higher call loads and provide integrated access to LAN and WAN backbones."
LANs, or local area networks, connect computers within an office, while WANs, or wide area networks, provide links beyond an office.
Cisco Systems was the market leader for the first quarter with revenues of $309.3 million, or 33 percent of the market, Dataquest said.
Ascend Communications had $100.33 million in revenues, or an 11 percent market share. Bay Networks followed with $88.71 million, or 9 percent.
Cisco's lead is attributed to its dominance in the branch office router segment, which accounts for 54 percent of the entire remote access systems market, Dataquest said.

The fastest-growing segment of the remote access systems market is for equipment known as concentrators, which draw together incoming voice or Internet communications into a single console at a central location, Dataquest said.

The concentrator market grew 88 percent in the second half of 1995 from the previous six months, making it the fastest-growing segment of remote access systems, it said. In the first quarter of 1996, remote access concentrators revenue has already reached $208 million.
Dataquest is a unit of Gartner Group Co.
